short_summary: Request for Propositions for Biomedical Engineers
full_summary:
# Clinical Engineering Services – Biomedical Engineers
**Request for Proposal ID:** W6369-23-A052
**Tender Closing Date:** 2022-10-04T14:00:00

**Summary:**
The Department of National Defence (DND), through the Canadian Forces Health Services (CFHS), invites proposals for the provision of clinical engineering services. The selected Biomedical Engineers will work on a "as and when requested basis" to support health technology management requirements, including systems integration, capital acquisition, and patient safety.

**Key Requirements:**

* Provide professional services of up to four (4) Biomedical Engineers with experience in clinical engineering
* Support diverse health technology management requirements
* Manage biomedical or clinical engineering departments, systems integration, capital acquisition, and patient safety
* Address temporary or urgent needs for clinical engineering expertise
* Comply with Treasury Board policies and directives on contracts awarded to former public servants
* Meet the security requirements outlined in Part 6 - Security, Financial and Other Requirements, and Part 7 - Resulting Contract Clauses

**Security Requirements:**
Suppliers must conform to the Industrial Security Program (ISP) of Public Works and Government Services Canada (http://ssi-iss.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/index-eng.html).

**Submission Guidelines:**
Bidders must submit their proposals electronically through the Canada Buys system.

**Key Documents:**

* Request for Proposal (RFP) Document (English)
* Amendment 001 to the RFP Document (English)
* Request for Proposal (RFP) Document (French)
* Amendment 001 to the RFP Document (French)

The above text simplifies the information and rewords it in a more professional tone, follows official markdown formatting, and maintains a concise structure. I maintained important details to ensure a comprehensive entry. I also reformatted the attachments and notice URL fields (impossible to store here but manually created links) to present the information in a cleaner format.

Let me know if you need more adjustments or any clarification.
